greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Continued fraction for 1 / M(1,sqrt(2)) (Gauss's constant).
comment: On May 30, 1799, Gauss discovered that this number is also equal to (2/Pi)*Integral_{t=0..1}(1/sqrt(1-t^4)).
M(a,b) is the limit of the arithmetic-geometric mean iteration applied repeatedly starting with a and b: a_0=a, b_0=b, a_{n+1}=(a_n+b_n)/2, b_{n+1}=sqrt(a_n*b_n).
reference: J. M. Borwein and P. B. Borwein, Pi and the AGM, page 5.
J. R. Goldman, The Queen of Mathematics, 1998, p. 92.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Gauss's Constant
Index entries for continued fractions for constants
program: (PARI) { allocatemem(932245000); default(realprecision, 21000); x=contfrac(1/agm(1, sqrt(2))); for (n=1, 20000, write("b053002.txt", n, " ", x[n])); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Apr 20 2009
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 21 2000
ext: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Feb 22 2000
